author: Miguel Lo-A-Foe
title: Software Engineer
introduction: I am a goal driven Software Engineer with 5+ years of experience working on in-house software development, as well as providing consultancy for large multinational enterprises worldwide. I enjoy gathering extensive knowledge on new and developing technology in order to contribute to projects and teams.

experience.title: Lead Software Engineer
responsibilities: Led a team of 6 other developers, of which 3 junior-mid and 3 mid-senior.
Aligned with stakeholders to define technical scope and requirements in order to deliver quality on time.
Authored the foundational architecture documentation detailing the concepts, technical designs and rationale.
Implemented fundamental, distributed microservices capable of processing millions of data-points daily.
Provisioned and managed public cloud infrastructure for 100+ unique sites across the globe.
Developed and maintained CI/CD pipelines, focusing on automated tests and security checks.

projects.name: ReSource
description: ReSource is the first decentralized platform to successfully trace battery materials across the globe from mines to electric vehicle producers for the creation of battery passports.

I led the design and implementation of core platform features and infrastructure from the beginning of the project's development. In order to carry out this responsibility, I had continuous discussions with architects from the consortium and aligned the requirements with our internal design and technical teams.

I was responsible for provisioning and maintaining the public cloud infrastructure, integrating different external cloud services and implementing tooling necessary for development and deployment of the platform.

I guided junior developers from picking up their first test tasks to independently drafting and implementing new system architecture designs. I was also responsible for evaluating the team and creating personal development plans with them.

When the project was in its final stages, I was responsible for the handover of the live platform to the consortium's internal development team. This included the creation of extensive documentation and training sessions for the new team.

projects.name: Aleo Explorer
description: The Aleo Explorer is a web platform designed to provide detailed information about the Aleo blockchain network. It allows users to search and explore data related to blocks, transactions, and accounts within the Aleo ecosystem.
I worked on containerizing the Aleo node (snarkOS) and then implemented the backend for retrieving and caching the data from the node for displaying in the frontend.

projects.name: Falcon
description: Falcon is a MVP platform that aims to replace paper-based audits of machine parts with a digital audit trail across multiple companies in the gas and oil supply chain.
I worked on designing and implementing the backend microservices of the platform.

projects.name: reciChain
description: reciChain is an initiative developed for BASF that leverages blockchain to improve the traceability and circularity of plastics in the value chain.
I was tasked with architecting, developing and deploying the smart contracts and blockchain infrastructure for the initial pilots.
